010package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
011
012/**
013 * <p>
014 * This class represents a linear chromatic adaptation transform,
015 * mapping XYZ color coordinates from a source white (reference) point
016 * to a target white point. 
017 * Both white points are passed to the constructor.
018 * The actual color mapping is done by method {@link #applyTo(float[])}.
019 * See the Section 14.6 of [1] for additional details and examples.
020 * </p>
021 * <p>
022 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; 
023 * An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
024 * </p>
025 */
026public class XYZscalingAdaptation implements ChromaticAdaptation {
027        
028        private final double[] W21;             // vector with diagonal scale factors
029
030        /**
031         * Constructor accepting two white points (XYZ-coordinates).
032         * @param XYZ1 source white point
033         * @param XYZ2 target white point
034         */
035        public XYZscalingAdaptation(double[] XYZ1, double[] XYZ2) {
036                W21 = new double[3];
037                for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
038                        W21[i] = XYZ2[i] / XYZ1[i];
039                }
040        }
041        
042        /**
043         * Constructor accepting two {@link StandardIlluminant} instances for
044         * specifying the source and target white points.
045         * @param illum1 source illuminant
046         * @param illum2 target illuminant
047         */
048        public XYZscalingAdaptation(StandardIlluminant illum1, StandardIlluminant illum2) {
049                this(illum1.getXYZ(), illum2.getXYZ());
050        }
051
052        @Override
053        public float[] applyTo(float[] XYZ1) {
054                final float[] XYZ2 = new float[3];
055                for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
056                        XYZ2[i] = (float) (XYZ1[i] * W21[i]);
057                }
058                return XYZ2;
059        }
060
061        @Override
062        public double[] applyTo(double[] XYZ1) {
063                final double[] XYZ2 = new double[3];
064                for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
065                        XYZ2[i] = XYZ1[i] * W21[i];
066                }
067                return XYZ2;
068        }
069
070}
